	<item>
		<title>Info For Performers</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/06/info-for-performers/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 24 Jun 2010 15:22:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pyromancy.mirrorlabs.com/?p=99</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[ If you are here because you want to spin fire, we're more then excited to have you! Even if you've never picked up a toy before, we are more then willing to teach. Right now, we generally practice alongside the Buffalo Jugglers in Delaware Park. We're not there all the time, but there is always a great group of awesome people who will teach you something. If you drop us a message, we can make sure to go or arrange for a meetup when it's more convenient. 

<strong>Buffalo Jugglers Club Meets:</strong>
 Monday - 7:00 pm to 9:00 pm
 Saturday - 10:00 am to 12:00 noon
<em> Delaware Park, near the Rose Garden on Lincoln Parkway (behind the Albright Knox Art Gallery ) </em>
<a href="http://www.facebook.com/home.php?#!/group.php?gid=111512332211132">• Buffalo Juggler Facebook Group</a> 


]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>First Friday Gallery Walk in Allentown!!!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/06/first-friday-gallery-walk-in-allentown/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 26 Jun 2010 22:50:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pyromancy.mirrorlabs.com/?p=128</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We're looking for someone in Allentown who would like to host Pyromancy next Friday for the gallery walk.  We need an outdoor space, the larger the better to spin fire at.  You want a ton of people at your place, we'll bring them in.  We're looking to do 15-30 minutes of spinning not long after dusk, 9:30 or so.  This will be all sorts of fun, your patrons will have a fantastic time and nothing draws in crowds like fire.  We'll put up fliers and advertise online, all we ask is to be able to pass a hat.  If things go well, we'd love to have a place we could perform at on a semi regular basis.  

The space should be at least 20x20 feet, not counting space for a crowd, with no low hanging wires or trees and reasonably smooth ground.  We'll bring our own barriers, musician (David Adamzyk on the Violin) and all the rest of the supplies we need.  

Who couldn't use a free fire show?]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?p=301</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=301</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[CURTAIN UP!, Buffalo's annual celebration opening the theatre season, roars back on Friday, September 10th for its 29th edition. This year's extravaganza features a locally connected Broadway star as the Honorary Chairman and no less than sixteen participating professio<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/39829_145140482181254_122686294426673_328208_7761042_n.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-302" title="Curtain Up! 2010 Buffalo" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/39829_145140482181254_122686294426673_328208_7761042_n-176x300.jpg" alt="Curtain Up! 2010 Buffalo" width="176" height="300" /></a>nal theatres.

Buffalo's professional theatre scene blasts off each September with the nationally recognized CURTAIN UP! celebration. It offers a creative black-tie Gala Dinner on the stage of Shea's Buffalo, though many choose to spend the evening at one of the many downtown restaurants that are eager to welcome back the theatre crowd.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>OMG!  It&#039;s COLD!!!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?p=532</link>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It's WAY too cold to want to play much these days, we've been hibernating, making costumes, new toys, here and there going to a gym, but other then that, not a lot of fire.  If you are interested in having us, do drop us a line, especially if you have somewhere warm,]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>A Word About Safety</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?p=2009</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=2009</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We here at Pyromancy take safety as our first, second, and even third concern, hence the slogan "Safety Third".  

In all seriousness, we're proud to say we've never had a serious injury at one of our shows, practices, or even when just messing around.  We train carefully with our props before lighting up, yearly go through a two hour safety class we've created, and hold regular discussions on how we can improve our communications, set-up, and techniques.  We also take yearly trips to the WildFire Retreat where we talk with other fire artists and learn new techniques. 



On this note, we have decided we will no longer be doing fire-breathing in our standard packages, this season it will be an add-on at additional cost.  The fact is, fire breathing is chronically dangerous.  No matter how good your technique is, fuel drips into your lungs, wind changes direction, ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Niagara Celtic Heritage Festival – September 19th 2015 (DRAFT)</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?p=2065</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=2065</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/11227982_10153362703036031_6579330163986551469_o.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/11227982_10153362703036031_6579330163986551469_o-600x900.jpg" alt="11227982_10153362703036031_6579330163986551469_o" width="600" height="900" class="alignnone size--post-size wp-image-2072" /></a>OLD POST 

<div align='center'><img class="size-Medium585 wp-image-1800 aligncenter" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/1544949_765633880131209_713786374_n-585x216.jpg" alt="1544949_765633880131209_713786374_n" width="585" height="216" /></div>

Fire Show by Pyromancy @ 9:00 PM

<strong>Niagara Celtic Heritage Festival</strong> | Krull Park 6108 Lake Rd, Olcott, New York 14126 | September 13th 2014

Join us for our 14th Annual Niagara Celtic Heritage Festival &amp; Highland Games!!

Admission Prices: Weekend $25 | Saturday $20 | Sunday $12

This year it's being held on September 13th &amp; 14th. History will come alive at Krull Park, inside the charming village of Olcott Beach. Guests of this yearly festival, just a one hour drive from both Buffalo and Rochester, will find themselves immersed in the traditions and pageantry of Ireland, Scotland, and Wales. Live Celtic music, dancers, sports, clans, living historians, vendors, food, contests and children's activities come together to make the festival a truly memorable day for all! Pre-Sale Tickets Available, Save $$ order early! Click to Order: http://bit.ly/niagaracelttix

<div align='center'>
<img class="size-full wp-image-1799 aligncenter" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/1236917_10151897027676031_1553572719_n.jpg" alt="1236917_10151897027676031_1553572719_n" width="200" height="200" /></div>

Related Links:

- <a href="https://www.facebook.com/events/692401084151773/">Facebook Event Link</a>

- <a href="http://www.niagaraceltic.com/">Niagara Celtic Website </a>
]]></content:encoded>

(function () {
  var scriptURL = 'https://sdks.shopifycdn.com/buy-button/latest/buy-button-storefront.min.js';
  if (window.ShopifyBuy) {
    if (window.ShopifyBuy.UI) {
      ShopifyBuyInit();
    } else {
      loadScript();
    }
  } else {
    loadScript();
  }

  function loadScript() {
    var script = document.createElement('script');
    script.async = true;
    script.src = scriptURL;
    (document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0] || document.getElementsByTagName('body')[0]).appendChild(script);
    script.onload = ShopifyBuyInit;
  }

  function ShopifyBuyInit() {
    var client = ShopifyBuy.buildClient({
      domain: 'pyromancy.myshopify.com',
      apiKey: '350cd143fb21b4226fc8cc7d43d88b09',
      appId: '6',
    });

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?p=2219</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pyromancy.org/?p=2219</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div id='collection-component-70059873721'></div>
<script type="text/javascript">
/*<![CDATA[*/

(function () {
  var scriptURL = 'https://sdks.shopifycdn.com/buy-button/latest/buy-button-storefront.min.js';
  if (window.ShopifyBuy) {
    if (window.ShopifyBuy.UI) {
      ShopifyBuyInit();
    } else {
      loadScript();
    }
  } else {
    loadScript();
  }

  function loadScript() {
    var script = document.createElement('script');
    script.async = true;
    script.src = scriptURL;
    (document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0] || document.getElementsByTagName('body')[0]).appendChild(script);
    script.onload = ShopifyBuyInit;
  }

  function ShopifyBuyInit() {
    var client = ShopifyBuy.buildClient({
      domain: 'pyromancy.myshopify.com',
      apiKey: '350cd143fb21b4226fc8cc7d43d88b09',
      appId: '6',
    });

    ShopifyBuy.UI.onReady(client).then(function (ui) {
      ui.createComponent('collection', {
        id: 400134222,
        node: document.getElementById('collection-component-70059873721'),
        moneyFormat: '%24%7B%7Bamount%7D%7D',
        options: {
  "product": {
    "buttonDestination": "modal",
    "variantId": "all",
    "contents": {
      "imgWithCarousel": false,
      "variantTitle": false,
      "options": false,
      "description": false,
      "buttonWithQuantity": false,
      "quantity": false
    },
    "text": {
      "button": "VIEW PRODUCT"
    },
    "styles": {
      "product": {
        "@media (min-width: 601px)": {
          "max-width": "calc(25% - 20px)",
          "margin-left": "20px",
          "margin-bottom": "50px"
        }
      },
      "button": {
        "background-color": "#d3c25a",
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-size": "13px",
        "padding-top": "14.5px",
        "padding-bottom": "14.5px",
        "padding-left": "22px",
        "padding-right": "22px",
        ":hover": {
          "background-color": "#beaf51"
        },
        "border-radius": "5px",
        "font-weight": "normal",
        ":focus": {
          "background-color": "#beaf51"
        }
      },
      "variantTitle": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-weight": "normal"
      },
      "title": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-weight": "normal",
        "font-size": "16px",
        "color": "#8c8667"
      },
      "description": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-weight": "normal"
      },
      "price": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-weight": "normal"
      },
      "quantityInput": {
        "font-size": "13px",
        "padding-top": "14.5px",
        "padding-bottom": "14.5px"
      },
      "compareAt": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-weight": "normal"
      }
    },
    "googleFonts": [
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans"
    ]
  },
  "cart": {
    "contents": {
      "button": true
    },
    "styles": {
      "button": {
        "background-color": "#d3c25a",
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-size": "13px",
        "padding-top": "14.5px",
        "padding-bottom": "14.5px",
        ":hover": {
          "background-color": "#beaf51"
        },
        "border-radius": "5px",
        "font-weight": "normal",
        ":focus": {
          "background-color": "#beaf51"
        }
      },
      "footer": {
        "background-color": "#ffffff"
      }
    },
    "googleFonts": [
      "Droid Sans"
    ]
  },
  "modalProduct": {
    "contents": {
      "img": false,
      "imgWithCarousel": true,
      "variantTitle": false,
      "buttonWithQuantity": false,
      "quantity": false
    },
    "styles": {
      "product": {
        "@media (min-width: 601px)": {
          "max-width": "100%",
          "margin-left": "0px",
          "margin-bottom": "0px"
        }
      },
      "button": {
        "background-color": "#d3c25a",
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-size": "13px",
        "padding-top": "14.5px",
        "padding-bottom": "14.5px",
        "padding-left": "22px",
        "padding-right": "22px",
        ":hover": {
          "background-color": "#beaf51"
        },
        "border-radius": "5px",
        "font-weight": "normal",
        ":focus": {
          "background-color": "#beaf51"
        }
      },
      "variantTitle": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "color": "#ffffff",
        "font-weight": "normal"
      },
      "title": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-weight": "normal",
        "color": "#ffffff"
      },
      "description": {
        "color": "#ffffff",
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-weight": "normal"
      },
      "price": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-size": "16px",
        "color": "#dad7d7",
        "font-weight": "normal"
      },
      "quantityInput": {
        "font-size": "13px",
        "padding-top": "14.5px",

      },
      "compareAt": {
        "font-size": "13.6px",
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "font-weight": "normal"
      }
    },
    "googleFonts": [
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans"
    ]
  },
  "toggle": {
    "styles": {
      "toggle": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "background-color": "#d3c25a",
        ":hover": {
          "background-color": "#beaf51"
        },
        "font-weight": "normal",
        ":focus": {
          "background-color": "#beaf51"
        }
      },
      "count": {
        "font-size": "13px"
      }
    },
    "googleFonts": [
      "Droid Sans"
    ]
  },
  "modal": {
    "styles": {
      "modal": {
        "background-color": "#645517"
      }
    }
  },
  "option": {
    "styles": {
      "label": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif",
        "color": "#ffffff"
      },
      "select": {
        "font-family": "Droid Sans, sans-serif"
      }
    },
    "googleFonts": [
      "Droid Sans",
      "Droid Sans"
    ]
  },
  "productSet": {
    "styles": {
      "products": {
        "@media (min-width: 601px)": {
          "margin-left": "-20px"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
      });
    });
  }
})();
/*]]]]><![CDATA[>*/
</script>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pyromancy Fire for the Future!  With Special Guest David Adamczyk!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/06/pyromancy-fire-for-the-future-with-special-guest-david-adamczyk/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 28 Jun 2010 17:52:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pyromancy.mirrorlabs.com/?p=140</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Pyromancy Performance Art</strong>
<em>Pyromancy! Fire for the Future!<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/06/3-43.jpg"></a></em>

<em><a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/06/3-43.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-150" title="Advert Image - Potter " src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/06/3-43-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></a>
Buffalo, NY</em>

Pyromancy is Buffalo's premier fire performance team and tonight we'll be offering a special preview of our Infringement show next month!

We'll be performing at The Bend (256 Allen) with David Adamczyk accompanying us on the violin.

Gillian will be astounding you with her dazzling hoops and baton routines!

Potter will invoking the elements with the quick flourishes of their staff and the heavier beats of the steel fans. Once the wars have been properly set, they will consume and will be consumed by the flames.

Leo will be making his debut showing with Pyromancy, bringing his lightning fast poi to the stage for a performance that will take your breath away.

And David Adamczyk on the violin. When he's not playing the street corners in Allentown he's moonlighting at some of the biggest music halls in the country. We're blessed to have a true virtuoso to accompany us.
So 10pm, come down to The bend and prepared to be astounded!
<ul>
	<li><a href="http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=132820546738347" target="_self">Facebook Event - RSVP! </a></li>
	<li><a href="http://www.firstfridaysallentown.com/events/firstfriday/event.html?ID=3">First Friday Allentown Gallery Walk  Galleries, Events, Performers...</a></li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Check out this <a href="http://blogs.buffalonews.com/artsbeat/2010/07/pyromancy-in-days-park.html">article </a>and video of wednesday's <a href="http://infringebuffalo.org/show.php?id=4">Infringment Festival show</a>. You can check out our final show for Infringement Festival Sunday August 1st at 9:30 pm in Days Park (<a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=days+park+buffalo&sll=42.560992,-79.140549&sspn=0.007744,0.0159&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=Days+Park,+Buffalo,+Erie,+New+York+14201&ll=42.900003,-78.880033&spn=0.007702,0.0159&t=h&z=16&iwloc=A">map</a>) in Buffalo NY! Hope to see you there!  

<object width="400" height="225"><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true" /><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always" /><param name="movie" value="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=13739324&amp;server=vimeo.com&amp;show_title=1&amp;show_byline=1&amp;show_portrait=0&amp;color=&amp;fullscreen=1" /><embed src="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=13739324&amp;server=vimeo.com&amp;show_title=1&amp;show_byline=1&amp;show_portrait=0&amp;color=&amp;fullscreen=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" allowscriptaccess="always" width="400" height="225"></embed></object><p><a href="http://vimeo.com/13739324">Pyromancy in Days Park</a> from <a href="http://vimeo.com/user1592863">Colin Dabkowski</a> on <a href="http://vimeo.com">Vimeo</a>.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pyromancy performing at Buffalo Infringement Festival</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/07/pyromancy-performing-at-buffalo-infringement-festival/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 31 Jul 2010 19:37:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=189</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One last minute reminder that PYROMANCY will be performing our final show for <a href="http://infringebuffalo.org/show.php?id=4">Infringement Festival</a> Sunday August 1st at 9:30 pm in Days Park (<a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=days+park+buffalo&sll=42.560992,-79.140549&sspn=0.007744,0.0159&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=Days+Park,+Buffalo,+Erie,+New+York+14201&ll=42.900003,-78.880033&spn=0.007702,0.0159&t=h&z=16&iwloc=A">map</a>) in Buffalo NY! Hope to see you there!  . This performance will be spectacular with some new surprises.

Pyromancy also has some secret guests! Day's Park is at the West end of Allen st.  (<a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=days+park+buffalo&sll=42.560992,-79.140549&sspn=0.007744,0.0159&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=Days+Park,+Buffalo,+Erie,+New+York+14201&ll=42.900003,-78.880033&spn=0.007702,0.0159&t=h&z=16&iwloc=A">map</a>)

<li>• Check out the <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?page_id=9&ics-perm=e139159619451231@facebook.com">event information</a></li>
<li>• Read the <a href=""http://blogs.buffalonews.com/artsbeat/2010/07/pyromancy-in-days-park.html"">article</a> about this show in Buffalo News Artbeats Blog </li>

Hope to see you there!
]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Pyromancy Page on Facebook</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/08/pyromancy-page-on-facebook/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 09 Aug 2010 22:04:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=262</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: center;"><br/><a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Pyromancy/133469663347637?ref=ts" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" src="http://static.ak.fbcdn.net/rsrc.php/z1M25/hash/5u84f48n.gif" alt="" /></a></p>
<p>We now have a <a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Pyromancy/133469663347637?ref=ts">fan page</a> on Facebook where official event announcements and news will be posted in addition to this website. Please click "Like" to get updates and information if you are a Facebook user.</p>
If you are a performer/drummer/photographer/safety who would like to be part of our collective, please join our <a href="http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=175031977219#!/group.php?gid=127467393957065&amp;ref=mf">internal group</a> where we will be sending out regular updates with practice schedules, performances and other information. Please include a brief letter of intent when joining because membership is moderated. We look forward to hearing from you!
<p style="text-align: center;">Links:
- <a title="Receive updates and Information about upcoming shows!" href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Pyromancy/133469663347637?ref=ts">Pyromancy Facebook Page</a>
- <a title="Interested in performing with us or learning to spin fire? Join this group!" href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Pyromancy/133469663347637?ref=ts#%21/group.php?gid=127467393957065&amp;ref=mf">Pyromancy Performers Facebook Group</a></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>August Wildfire Contact Staff Workshop!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/08/august-wildfire-contact-staff-workshop/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Aug 2010 05:39:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=286</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This weekend several performers from Pyromancy will be heading to <a href="http://www.wildfireretreat.com/">August 2010 Wildfire Retreat</a> for a weekend of workshops and fun. Wildfire is the East Coast's premier spinning and fire arts training camp. This is a community oriented  event, offering a diverse selection of over 105 classes on poi, hoop, dance, teaching, safety, business, performance, and more. This weekend-long event is held in Northeast Connecticut. 
<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/about/gillian-tunney/">
Gillian Tunney</a>  will be teaching an <a href="http://www.wildfireretreat.com/wildfireretreat.com/wwwroot/PopUpClassInfo.aspx?ClassID=1109">Intermediate Contact Staff workshop on FISHTAILS</a>! This workshop will be held on Saturday August 21, 4:20-5:30pm. 
Course Description:
<blockquote><em>Learn fishtails! Learn the basic reverse fishtail, and how to transition into and out of it. While this class is primarily intended for the fishtail-less, we will also touch upon variations to spruce up the basic move.</em></blockquote>
Fishtails are a challenging move that I learned in baton twirling when I was younger, and is commonly used in fire contact staff to link different moves together without having to grab the staff with your hand. The baton/staff does a 1-beat twirling motion that is balanced on the back of the hand. The name "fishtail" comes from the side-to-side swimming motion the hand makes ( also it looks like you are drawing an infinity symbol with your hand when viewed from the front ), this is needed to maintain the speed and balance of the baton/staff. Hopefully once I figure out what the best way to teach this, I will make a tutorial to post here in case anyone else is interested. 

As of 8/18/2010 there are 30 tickets to August Wildfire remaining, so if you are interested in going you should definitely check it out!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Dragon Ritual Drummers &quot;Warriors of the Earth&quot;</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/09/dragon-ritual-drummers-warriors-of-the-earth/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Sep 2010 02:03:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=312</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<font align="center">[caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="340" caption="courtesy of "]<a href="http://www.dragonritualdrummers.com/Photo-Gallery.php?currDir=.&amp;pageType=imageℑ=01.JPG"><img title="Dragon Ritual Drummers " src="http://www.dragonritualdrummers.com/albums_b0d2360b6435424350ca6eb94866bc6f/01.JPG" alt="Dragon Ritual Drummers " width="340" /></a>[/caption]</font>

September 4, 2010 we had the honor of doing fire performance at the Dragon Ritual Drummers "Warriors of the Earth" Ceremony and Concert held at Nine Woods Forest. This eclectic drumming troupe from the Niagara region is a festival favorite at Brushwood Folklore Center, and I first got to hear them closing up the musical stage on Saturday night of Sirius Rising 2010.  Their music is energetic and dance inspiring, drawing inspiration from cultures around the world.  The songs are primarily instrumental, focused on tribal percussion with minimal toned instruments and vocal chanting. During live shows, the band engages the audience with stories of the songs background, and by the end of the set you are left feeling that you truly went on journey.  - <em>Gillian Tunney</em>

From the last.fm page:
<blockquote><em>The Dragon Ritual Drummers are a drumming troupe consisting of members of the Niagara Pagan Men’s circle. The group began as a way for us to express the wonderful magick and manifestation that we routinely share. We chose the Dragon Ritual Drummers name for the infamous dragon spirit that resides in and around the brink of Niagara falls. With the original inhabitants now extinct, we began to awaken and befriend the dragon spirit through meditations, offerings and ritual.</em></blockquote>
Dragon Ritual Drummers are playing next at Rochester Pagan Pride in Rochester NY on Sep 11 2010  at3:00Pm
Read more: http://www.myspace.com/dragonritualdrummers#ixzz0ytqMtjib
Related Links:

- <a href="http://www.dragonritualdrummers.com/">Dragon Ritual Drummers</a>
- <a href="http://www.myspace.com/dragonritualdrummers">Myspace</a>
- <a href="http://www.last.fm/music/Dragon+Ritual+Drummers">Last.fm</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Curtain Up!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/09/curtain-up/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Sep 2010 23:39:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=348</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/2010_curtain_up_poster11.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/2010_curtain_up_poster11-176x300.jpg" alt="" title="2010_curtain_up_poster[1]" width="176" height="300" class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-349" /></a>

Pyromancy will be busking on Main Street this Friday for the kick off to the "legitimate" theater season!  Come see us next to the Bijou Grill, just look for the torches.  We'll be doing shows once an hour or so between 5 and 8, then heading over to The VAuLT for another show just for them, then hitting the streets again at 10pm till when ever people go home!  There's going to be tons of great music, artists, vendors, and food, Curtain Up! one of the better parties of the year, hope to see you there.

AND Thursday night, 7:30pm Channel 4 WIVB will be showing a preview of whats lined up for the night, so be sure to catch that if you have any doubts as if you'll be coming.  

]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Announcements</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/09/353/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 11 Sep 2010 18:36:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=353</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We'd like to thank everyone who came out to Curtain Up! last night, we had an amazing time.  If you have any pictures or video, we'd love to add them to our portfolio, drop us a message at info@pyromancy.org  

I'd like to give special thanks to the Bijou Grill for helping us with power at last minute, Channel 4 for the coverage in their preview special, The VAuLT where we helped kick off their one year anniversary party, and most of all to Jerry Burgin who coordinated the entire Curtain Up! event.  

Pyromancy will be having a business meeting 7pm, September 14th at Towne Restraurant, for all performers, safeties, newbies, photographers, musicians, anyone who wishes to be involved in our collective.  We've got a lot to go over, there's much excitement abound.  

<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/party-for-the-parks.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/party-for-the-parks-200x300.jpg" alt="" title="party for the parks" width="200" height="300" class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-355" /></a>

September 24th we'll be performing at Delaware park at the Party for the Parks Olmstead Foundation Fundraiser.  For a mere twenty dollars you'll get Salsa, Mariachi, Beach Volleyball, Food, Drinks, FIRE!  It's going to be a fantastic time and it's all going to Buffalo's glorious park system.  You can purchase <a href="http://store.bfloparks.org/merchant2/merchant.mvc?Screen=PROD&Product_Code=PFP_2010&Category_Code=PFP&Product_Count=0">tickets here.</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Preview of Olmstead Party for the Parks!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/09/preview-of-olmstead-party-for-the-parks/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Sep 2010 22:21:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=367</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<object height="288" width="470"><param name="movie" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" value="http://www.wkbw.com/v/?i=103141639" /><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always" /><param name="wmode" value="transparent" /><param name="AllowFullScreen" value="true" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" src="http://www.wkbw.com/v/?i=103141639" AllowFullScreen="true" allowScriptAccess="always" height="288" wmode="transparent" width="470"></embed></object>

<strong>Olmsted Party for the Parks</strong>
By WKBW Programming

BUFFALO, NY (WKBW) - Buffalo Olmsted Conservancy's Party for the Parks fundraiser will take place on Friday, September 24th at Olmsted Park. The theme is South Beach Salsa.

Channel 7's owns Bridget Blythe will be hosting the event. There will be a number of bands to help set the mood, fire dancers and a scooter give-away. Food and drinks will also be sold. 

<a href="http://www.wkbw.com/news/local/Olmsted-Party-for-the-Parks-103141639.html">Full article on WKBW</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>367</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2010-09-17 22:21:26]]></wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[preview-of-olmstead-party-for-the-parks]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>September Spin Jam!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/09/september-spin-jam/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 25 Sep 2010 14:29:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=402</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It'll be a cool night, but the fire will keep us warm! <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/36393_554380275831_51004577_32611423_4067925_n.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-403" title="36393_554380275831_51004577_32611423_4067925_n" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/36393_554380275831_51004577_32611423_4067925_n-225x300.jpg" alt="" width="225" height="300" /></a>

Come to Lasalle Park this Sunday at 9:30 pm. Pyromancy and any fire performers are having a meet and greet to practice, play and talk. There will be a casual Fire Eating instructional as well as a Safety Training.

Photographers are welcomed! Please take photos of us and submit them to the Pyromancy website. This is a great opportunity to expand your art with some interesting subjects.

We usually reside by the Amphitheater by the river. See you there!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>My Fire Family</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/09/408/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Sep 2010 04:54:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=408</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/Pyromancy-Group-shot.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/Pyromancy-Group-shot-300x214.jpg" alt="As the WordPRess example suggests, &quot;The Mona Lisa&quot;" title="Pyromancy Group shot" width="300" height="214" class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-409" /></a>
Thanks to everyone who came out for Party in the Parks,  I couldn't have done it with out you.  

Photo by Olga Grinberg

<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/photos-2/party-for-the-parks-spinjam-flickr/">Check out more photos from this event >></a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>New World Notes: Mixed Reality Portrait </title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/10/new-world-notes-mixed-reality-portrait/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 19 Oct 2010 17:44:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=464</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pyromancy performer <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/about/gillian-tunney/">Gillian Tunney</a> in New World Notes, a popular and long running blog covering Virtual Worlds and MMORG's
<a href="http://nwn.blogs.com/nwn/2010/10/delaney-whippet-sl-fire-dancer.html">Mixed Reality Profile: Delaney Whippet, the Girl Who Played With Fire (and Textured Prims)</a>

I have worked as a content creator in the Virtual World of Second Life for many years, and created a series of "fire props" for my avatar for this New World Notes feature. The profile was based around the this <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v4cDxWPL9Xo">video of me fire hooping!</a> Here is some pictures of my avatar with her virtual props! 

<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/delaney-baton.png"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/delaney-baton-300x231.png" alt="" title="Delaney Whippet" width="300" height="231" class="size-medium wp-image-465" /></a>

<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/delaney-hoop.png"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/delaney-hoop-300x231.png" alt="" title="delaney-hoop" width="300" height="231" class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-466" /></a>

- Gillian Tunney]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Pyromancy Demo Reel DVD now available!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/11/pyromancy-demo-reel-dvd-now-available/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 02 Nov 2010 05:14:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=491</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pyromancy Demo Reel DVD now available! It can run on your dvd player or computer and contains the <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Puv52gj1iWo">demo reel</a>, a slideshow and booking information. Please send your request to<a href="mailto:gillian@pyromancy.org"> gillian@pyromancy.org </a>or use our <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/contact/">contact page</a>.


<div align="center"><strong>Menu Preview:</strong><br/><a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/promodvd1.png"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/promodvd1-300x224.png" alt="" title="promodvd" width="300" height="224" class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-496" /></a></div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Tempest Air Grand Opening Performance on November 13th!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2010/11/tempest-air-grand-opening-performance-on-november-13th/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 12 Nov 2010 17:26:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=510</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Buffalo’s newest airbrushing store, Tempest Air, will officially be opening its doors for business on Monday, October 18.

Located at 459 Amherst Street ( <a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=459+amherst+st+14207&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=36.778911,83.847656&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=459+Amherst+St,+Buffalo,+Erie,+New+York+14207&z=16">map</a> ), the store will offer custom airbrush artwork services to any customer looking to add a little creativity to their clothing, shoes, license plates, musical instruments–you name it. “Literally, if you can squeeze it through our doors we can paint it up,” said owner Jenn Mayberry.

Tempest Air is located at 459 Amherst Street across from 464 Gallery. They are open Tuesday through Saturday from 12 p.m. to 8 p.m. Though they will be open for business on October 18, they will be hosting their grand opening celebration on November 13 at 7 p.m. The party will feature live music from Coterie of Stern and the Dragon Ritual Drummers, as well as a fire dancing performance by Pyromancy. Brickyard Pub will be catering the event.

More information at:
-<a href=" http://www.buffalorising.com/2010/10/amherst-street-welcomes-new-airbrushing-store.html">Buffalo Rising interview</a><br/>- <a href="http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=119467868111803">Tempest Air Grand Opening Facebook Invite</a>

 Jenn Mayberry, the owner of Tempest Air, created the Pyromancy sign that we display at all of our shows. This was created early in the summer before we had a style and logo on the website, and we provided very little direction outside of "fire" and a book of ancient South American Symbols for inspiration. I was very pleased to see she really listened to our ideas and incorporated the symbols we liked in fun and aesthetically pleasing ways with the text. The result was really really awesome and I would recommend to anyone looking for custom work that is creative and unique!

In addition to our fire performance, this is also a rare Buffalo Appearance for the <a href="http://www.dragonritualdrummers.com/">Dragon RItual Drummers</a> that is free and open to the public!<br/> <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/2010/09/dragon-ritual-drummers-warriors-of-the-earth/">Read the live show review </a>.

Come out and small businesses in the Blackrock area of Buffalo, see you there November 13th @ 7pm!
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pyromancy on Winter Break! </title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/01/omg-its-cold/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 13 Jan 2011 06:17:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=535</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It's WAY too cold to want to play much these days, we've been hibernating, making costumes, new toys, here and there going to a gym, but other then that, not a lot of fire.  If you are interested in having us, do drop us a line at our <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/contact/">contact page</a>, especially if you have somewhere indoors and warm for us to perform/play!

]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>February 12, 2011:  Dancing from the Heart</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/02/february-12-2011-dancing-from-the-heart/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 05 Feb 2011 02:27:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=552</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are excited to announce a special indoor performance at Storm Buffalo's <a href="http://heart.stormbuffalo.com/" target="_blank"><strong>Dancing From The Heart</strong></a>!
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/02/heart_flyer.png"><img class="size-medium wp-image-541 aligncenter" title="heart_flyer" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/02/heart_flyer-239x300.png" alt="" width="239" height="300" /></a></p>
<a href="http://www.stormbuffalo.com" target="_blank">STORM's</a> third annual fundraiser to benefit the <a href="http://www.varietykidstelethon.com/" target="_blank">The 49th Annual Variety Kids Telethon 2011,</a> Dancing from the Heart will take place at the Adam’s Mark Hotel ( <a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&amp;source=s_q&amp;hl=en&amp;geocode=&amp;q=Adam%E2%80%99s+Mark+Hotel,+120+Church+Street,+Buffalo,+NY+14202&amp;aq=&amp;sll=37.0625,-95.677068&amp;sspn=36.915634,59.414063&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;hq=adam%27s+mark+hotel&amp;hnear=120+Church+St,+Buffalo,+Erie,+New+York+14202&amp;z=16" target="_blank">map</a> ) on Saturday, February 12th from 12:00 noon to 11:30 p.m.  Dance workshops will take place from 12:00 noon to 7:00 p.m. in belly dance, ballroom, salsa, hip hop and more.  Guest instructors include Elena Grinenko and Tony Dovolani from ABC's "Dancing with the Stars" and Eddie Styles, JabbaWockeeZ crew member.  Evening entertainment will include a Venetian Masked Ball with general dancing, live performances, jugglers, jesters and more!

Admission on the day of the event is $75.00.
Evening Admission to the Live performances and the Venetian Masked Ball is $25.

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>* Performance by Pyromancy with special Fire and LED Props will be during the Venetian Masked Ball! * </strong></span>

The Adam’s Mark Hotel is located at <a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&amp;source=s_q&amp;hl=en&amp;geocode=&amp;q=Adam%E2%80%99s+Mark+Hotel,+120+Church+Street,+Buffalo,+NY+14202&amp;aq=&amp;sll=37.0625,-95.677068&amp;sspn=36.915634,59.414063&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;hq=adam%27s+mark+hotel&amp;hnear=120+Church+St,+Buffalo,+Erie,+New+York+14202&amp;z=16" target="_blank">120 Church Street Buffalo, NY 14202</a> and for more information or tickets, call 716/822-0299

Get more information at <a href="http://heart.stormbuffalo.com" target="_blank">Dancing With the Heart's website</a>.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Just got home from an AMAZING night at Dancing From the Heart!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/02/just-got-home-from-an-amazing-night-at-dancing-from-the-heart/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 13 Feb 2011 04:30:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=556</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[What a fantastic show!  We all got to light up the dance floor with fancy new LED toys, it was so pretty to see everyone going at once.  STORM Buffalo raised over SEVEN THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS for Variety Club, total success!

I want to thank all the amazing Pyromancers who came and performed, all the other dance troops, there were too many for me to recall, and Tommy Randon for organizing the night.  ]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Friday, March 18: Celebrate International Women&#039;s Day at Buffalo State College</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/03/friday-march-18-celebrate-international-womens-day-at-buffalo-state-college/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 12 Mar 2011 02:12:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=568</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/CelebrateInternationalWomensDay-.png"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/CelebrateInternationalWomensDay--228x300.png" alt="" title="100th Anniversary: Celebrate International Women&#039;s Day" width="228" height="300" class="size-medium wp-image-570" /></a>

Hi everyone! <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/about/gillian-tunney/">Gillian Tunney</a> from Pyromancy will be performing choreographed pieces with Hoops, Poi and Baton at the International Women's Day Event at Buffalo State College!

100th Anniversary: Celebrate International Women's Day
Friday, March 18, Buffalo State College
Student Union, Social Hall, 4-7:30pm

<strong>4-5:30 Panel Discussion: Rejecting the Violence of Poverty & Standing up for RIghts</strong>
Discussion and information about the rights of women contending with poverty, services available, issues facing immigrant women, experience in fighting for rights, and speaking to the causes of poverty and solutions.

<strong>6:00-7:30 Evening Celebration: Saluting Women's Contributions to the Rights and Dignity of All</strong>
Performers Include: Mc Vendetta, Jen Whitmore, Pat Bozeman, Gillian Tunney ( of Pyromancy ); Women at the Forefront in Egypt & Building People's Media

<strong>5:30 - 6:00 Networking Hour </strong>
Network and Socialize with speakers and performers, refreshments served!

 
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>568</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2011-03-11 21:12:22]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2011-03-12 02:12:22]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[friday-march-18-celebrate-international-womens-day-at-buffalo-state-college]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="category" nicename="events"><![CDATA[Events]]></category>

	<item>
		<title>March 26: Trimania 2011 </title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/03/587/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 20 Mar 2011 16:23:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=587</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/TrimaniaSave_PRINT-revise2.png"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/TrimaniaSave_PRINT-revise2-621x1024.png" alt="" title="Trimania" width="621" height="1024" class="alignnone size-large wp-image-588" /></a>

Location: 
Buffalo Arts Studio
2495 Main Street
Buffalo, NY, 14214

March 26, 2011
Sat:7:00 pm-1:00 am

Pyromancy will be performing outside from 7-7:45 and inside with Slyboots from 9-10

About
A HUGE party to benefit Buffalo Arts Studio!

Description
Whoa. There’s a giant party coming directly at you.
Prepare for the fourth Trimania in three mind-bending dimensions.

TICKETS:
$25 in advance
$30 at the door

TICKETS AVAILABLE ONLINE UNTIL FRIDAY, MARCH 18...
<a href="http://www.trimania.com">http://www.trimania.com</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>April 1st: Dance Your Art Off!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/03/april-1st-dance-your-art-off/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Mar 2011 14:24:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=596</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[ <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/Dance-your-art-off.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/Dance-your-art-off-199x300.jpg" alt="" title="Dance your art off" width="199" height="300" class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-597" /></a>
From Tony Billoni, creator of the Artists and Models Affairs, The JAM CLUB, the CRASH CLUB, and My Massive Throbbing Beat ....Dont miss this serious night of Dance Music and Environment -

You will experience:
NON-STOP DEEP HOUSE AND ELECTRONIC BEATS with
Legendary Mixmaster JOHN CEGLIA

Old Skool Meets the New Style in a Tripped Out Mash-Up
with special guest DJ CUTLER @ 9pm

Read more about this event in:
- <a href="http://artvoice.com/issues/v10n12/art_scene/dance_you_art_off">Artvoice: The Groove is in the Art</a>
- <a href="http://www.buffalorising.com/2011/03/come-dance-your-art-off.html">Buffalo Rising: Come Dance Your Art Off!</a>


Performance Artist David Butler creates environmental decor, featuring guest poi and fan dancers in a crazy mix of flow, fabric and light.

Interactive Installations created by: iPad Artist & No Kardashians!

Dress Code: Wear Your Art

Minimum donation:
$15 advance ; $20 at the door
Tickets available at TICKETS.COM, Ballroom box office and ArtVoice (881-6604)

Part of the <a href="http://www.giveforgreatness.org/">Give For Greatness</a> series of events raising $1 million to benefit cultural institutions that lost funding in this year's county budget. 
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Artvoice Video for Dance Your Art Off!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/04/video-dance-your-art-off/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Apr 2011 23:13:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=609</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[At the event Dance Your Art Off we spun LED props and Flags at various locations around the dance floor to enhance the Dj performances and create an interesting backdrop.

From Artvoice:
Dance Your Art Off, as the name suggests, is first a dance party and then an art party. Town Ballroom was transformed into an avant garde dance palace where respected deep house star John Ceglia and Buffalo-based artist DJ Cutler spun breakbeat, funk, hip hop, and deep house all night.

<a href="http://video.artvoice.com/artvoicetv.php?permalink=0000001368##ixzz1JpXnibb6">Read more at Artvoice</a>

<object width="640" height="356" data="http://video.artvoice.com/player/avtv.swf" type="application/x-shockwave-flash"><param name="movie" value="http://video.artvoice.com/player/avtv.swf" /><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true" /><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always" /><param name="flashvars" value='config={"playlist":[{"url":"http://video.artvoice.com/thumbs/artvoice-87409-Dance_Your_Art_Off-widescreen_web.flv-lg.jpg","scaling":"fit"},{"autoPlay":false,"autoBuffering":false,"scaling":"fit","accelerated":true,"url":"http://video.artvoice.com:8000/artvoice-87409-Dance_Your_Art_Off-widescreen_web.flv","provider":"lighttpd"}],"logo":{"url":"http://video.artvoice.com/player/watermark.png","fullscreenOnly":false,"opacity":0.2,"bottom":0,"left":8},"play":{"url":"http://video.artvoice.com/player/play.png","width":100,"height":100},"contextMenu":["Video Copyright ARTVOICE",{"Visit Artvoice TV":"function()"}],"plugins":{"lighttpd":{"url":"http://video.artvoice.com/player/streaming.swf"},"controls":{"url":"http://video.artvoice.com/player/controls.swf","left":0,"bottom":0,"opacity":0.95,"width":"100pct","autoHide":"always","background":"#114455","backgroundGradient":"low","all":true,"scrubber":true}},"clip":{}}' /><noscript><a href='http://video.artvoice.com/artvoicetv.php?permalink=0000001368#'>Dance Your Art Off | Artvoice TV</a></noscript></object>

Other press links from this event:

- <a href="http://artvoice.com/issues/v10n12/art_scene/dance_you_art_off">Artvoice: The Groove is in the Art</a>
- <a href="http://www.buffalorising.com/2011/03/come-dance-your-art-off.html">Buffalo Rising: Come Dance Your Art Off!</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Buffalo Riverfest!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/06/buffalo-riverfest/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 25 Jun 2011 19:08:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=636</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Its been kind of quiet around this website lately, but it early summer and we are getting ready ready for lots of cool upcoming shows! 

We got a chance to perform at Buffalo Riverfest this past weekend in the brand new Conway Park. We did a 15 minute show on both Friday and Saturday with both fire and LEDS. This was the first  event held in the recently constructed Buffalo River Fest Park. For some  news about the construction of this beautiful park, check out <a href="http://www.buffalorising.com/2011/05/pegs-park-will-soon-be-our-park.html">Buffalo Rising's article</a>. The area has been transformed from an the overgrown, littered lot into a festival park and  is worth taking the rid down to Ohio St to check it out.  Here is a <a href=" http://maps.google.com/maps?q=249+Ohio+Street+buffalo+ny&hl=en&ll=42.870303,-78.870378&spn=0.010348,0.019011&sll=42.870386,-78.869902&sspn=0.010411,0.019011&z=16 ">link</a> to the google map with an outdated street view. 
[caption id="attachment_637" align="alignnone" width="150" caption="Holly Rutkowski ( Insomnia Creation ) with the fire hoop! "]<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/IMG_4455.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/IMG_4455-150x150.jpg" alt="Holly Rutkowski ( Insomnia Creation ) with the fire hoop!" title="Holly Rutkowski ( Insomnia Creation ) with the fire hoop! " width="150" height="150" class="size-thumbnail wp-image-637" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_638" align="alignnone" width="150" caption="Gillian Tunney and her new LED Hoop!"]<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/IMG_4473.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/IMG_4473-150x150.jpg" alt="Gillian Tunney and her new LED Hoop!" title="Gillian Tunney and her new LED Hoop!" width="150" height="150" class="size-thumbnail wp-image-638" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_639" align="alignnone" width="150" caption="Potter Dee Fire Eating"]<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/IMG_4439.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/IMG_4439-150x150.jpg" alt="Potter Dee Fire Eating" title="Potter Dee Fire Eating" width="150" height="150" class="size-thumbnail wp-image-639" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_643" align="alignnone" width="150" caption="Buffalo Riverfest Park ( from Buffalo Rising )"]<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/River-Bufalo-Fest-PArk-thumb-660x499-21073.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/River-Bufalo-Fest-PArk-thumb-660x499-21073-150x150.jpg" alt="Buffalo Riverfest Park ( from Buffalo Rising )" title="Buffalo Riverfest Park ( from Buffalo Rising )" width="150" height="150" class="size-thumbnail wp-image-643" /></a>[/caption]

Quick clips of Gillian's performances on Saturday Night: 
<object width="480" height="390"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/tO4pe-kdZpk?version=3&amp;hl=en_US&amp;rel=0"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/tO4pe-kdZpk?version=3&amp;hl=en_US&amp;rel=0" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="480" height="390" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Hoop/Spin Jam - Thursday July 7th, Lasalle Park Amphitheater </title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/07/hoopspin-jam-thursday-july-7th-lasalle-park-amphitheater/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 05 Jul 2011 16:38:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=652</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The <a href="http://www.facebook.com/home.php?sk=group_105082141623">Buffalo Hula Hoop Group</a> and Pyromancy will be having an open invite Hoop and Spin Jam at Lasalle Park Amphitheater this Thursday from 7pm until after dark. <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/5521567092_d746e1044a_b.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/5521567092_d746e1044a_b-225x300.jpg" alt="" title="Hoop Jam" width="225" height="300" class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-653" /></a>This event is for anyone interested in learning hooping or other skill toys, come out and spin with us! There will have some extra hoops for people to use in case you do not have one. Other props like batons, poi, staff, juggling are also welcome. This will be a skill share, so if there is anything you would like to learn, please ask ! I can provide instruction for off-body moves / isolations and mini-hoops if anyone is interested. If you use fire props, we are able to burn when it gets dark but please bring your own fuel or a small donation to cover the cost of white gas if you want to use it. The amphitheater is almost always available, but if for some reason it is in use ( there was a martial arts class till 7:30 one time ) , we can meet out on the lawn until it is available. The amphitheater is covered so this event will be rain or shine. 


Photographers are welcomed! Please take photos of us and submit them to the hoop group or gillian [at] pyromancy.org . This is a great opportunity to expand your art with some interesting subjects.

- <a href="http://www.facebook.com/#!/event.php?eid=216037665105413">Facebook Event Link</a>
- Join the <a href="http://www.facebook.com/home.php?sk=group_105082141623">Buffalo Hula Hoop Group</a>
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Wednesday Night Concert Series at RiverFest Park</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/07/wednesday-night-concert-series-at-riverfest-park/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 31 Jul 2011 17:18:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=672</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/music-posterblue.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-676 aligncenter" title="Buffalo Riverfest Park Concert Series" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/music-posterblue-194x300.jpg" alt="" width="194" height="300" /></a>

<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/2011/06/buffalo-riverfest/">Last month we got to perform at the opening weekend of a new park on Ohio St.</a> Once a common post-industrial waste field, thanks to the work of Margaret "Peg" Overdorf and the <a href="http://www.thevalleycenter.com/">Valley Community Association</a>, Buffalo now has a fantastic new concert venue and boating park. For the next three weeks we will be performing between sets probably around 9pm.

Only Humen, also a Buffalo Hall of Music award winner and popular throughout Western New York, will perform on August 3rd. The band is led by Frank Pusateri who is native to the South Buffalo area.

Crash Cadillac, the fun interactive oldies band, will be featured on August 10th.

The series will wrap up on Wednesday, August 24th with the Town Pants, an international touring act. The Town Pants band, which hails from Vancouver, Canada, combines aspects of traditional Irish music, folk rock, and Americana, creating a unique brand of high energy “West Coast Celtic.” With their performance at the 2010 Winter Olympics in Vancouver and at festivals throughout United States, Canada and Europe, the group is a consistent audience favorite.

Food and refreshments will be available at all concerts.

More information at <a href="http://www.thevalleycenter.com/other_events.php">The Valley Center</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Buffalo Infringement Festival 2011 Street Performances!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/08/678/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 07 Aug 2011 00:42:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=678</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_637" align="alignnone" width="150" caption="Gillian : Fire Hoop"]<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Infringement-Hoops.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-681" title="Infringement Hoops" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Infringement-Hoops-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a>[/caption]
[caption id="attachment_637" align="alignnone" width="150" caption="Gillian : Fire Staff"]<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Happy-gilly-infringement.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-682" title="Happy gilly infringement" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Happy-gilly-infringement-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a>[/caption]
[caption id="attachment_637" align="alignnone" width="150" caption="Potter : Fire Fans"]<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Potter-infringements.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-683" title="Potter infringements" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Potter-infringements-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a>[/caption]

<a href="https://plus.google.com/114949517413129024112#114949517413129024112/posts">Photo Credit: Jose Rodriguez</a>

Been out on Allentown with Gillian the past few nights between Lagniappes Lucky Dogs and Nietzsches during Buffalo Infringement Festival 2011. Our audiences have been wonderful, last night some folks from 12/8th Path Band joined us on percussion and it was bloody awesome. They are our favorite band in Buffalo to play with and we are looking forward to being next to them at Curtain Up!

We'll be out tonight around midnight and quite possibly again tomorrow night.

Love sets Fire.
Potter Dee.


The Good Neighborhood: <a href="http://thegoodneighborhood.com/2011/08/09/where-the-heart-is-2011-infringement-fest-in-review/">Where the heART Is – 2011 Infringement Fest in Review</a>

<blockquote>"There is a spirit to the festival that would benefit us all if infused into the other 354 days of the year. It’s a sense of exploration, discovery, creativity, and celebration. It seems during those 11 bustling days that anything is possible – there are no boundaries, no restrictions, and no judgment. It’s a space where art is created organically and with intention, with the support of a strong and organized community."
       ~Anna Laurie Miller</blockquote>

]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Olmsted Party for the Parks 2011 - British Invasion! </title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/08/olmsted-party-for-the-parks-2011-british-invasion/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 25 Aug 2011 19:51:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=695</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<br/><br/><div align="center"><a rel="lightbox" href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Party-for-the-Parks-poster-8-23-11.png"><img class="size-medium wp-image-701 aligncenter" title="Party-for-the-Parks-poster-8-23-11" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Party-for-the-Parks-poster-8-23-11-171x300.png" alt="" width="171" height="300" /></a></div>

September 16, 2011
The 'British Invasion' takes over Delaware Park at Party for the Parks –an indoor/outdoor, over-21 party, 6 p.m. to 11 p.m., featuring live music, incredible auctions, lots of great food and drinks at the Marcy Casino. This year's bands, headlined by the If's, will be on a floating stage right on Hoyt Lake. It's all overlooking one of the Best scenic views in Buffalo! Proceeds from this great event benefit the Buffalo Olmsted Parks Conservancy. <a href="http://store.bfloparks.org/merchant2/merchant.mvc?Screen=CTGY&amp;Store_Code=TETC&amp;Category_Code=PFP">Get your tickets online here!</a>
- <a href="http://www.bfloparks.org/">Buffalo Olmsted Parks Conservancy Website </a>

<em>Pyromancy will be back again this year with an exciting fire performance featuring some new props and performers! We will going on at various times from sundown to 10:30pm! Potter Dee is working on an amazing surprise installation!</em>

Press Links:

- <strong>Buffalo Evening News, August 24,2011</strong>
Party for the Parks/ Gala Announcement :

<div align="center"><a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/302863_10150297167062840_609187839_7968975_7593638_n.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-696 aligncenter" title="Party in the Parks Promo: Gillian Tunney, Fire Hoop " src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/302863_10150297167062840_609187839_7968975_7593638_n-300x269.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="269" /></a></div>

- <strong>Buffalo Rising</strong>: <a href="http://www.buffalorising.com/2011/08/9th-annul-party-for-the-parks-british-invasion-in-buffalo.html">9th Annual Party for the Parks: British Invasion in Buffalo</a>

<div align="center"><a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/1-Party-Parks-2011-thumb-375xauto-22636.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-698 aligncenter" title="1-Party-Parks-2011-thumb-375xauto-22636" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/1-Party-Parks-2011-thumb-375xauto-22636.jpg" alt="" width="375" height="352" /></a></div>

- The Good Neighboorhood - <a href="http://thegoodneighborhood.com/2011/08/23/party-for-the-parks-brings-british-theme-to-benefit-olmsted-parks/">Party for the Parks Brings British Invasion Theme to Benefit Olmsted Parks </a>

<div align="center">[caption id="attachment_702" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Fire Eater Robert Turley at Party For the Parks 2010"]<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Party-for-the-Parks-pyromancy-8-23-11.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-702" title="Party-for-the-Parks-pyromancy-8-23-11" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Party-for-the-Parks-pyromancy-8-23-11-225x300.jpg" alt="" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>695</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>Terror Technologies Extreme Haunted House 2011</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2011/11/terror-technologies-extreme-haunted-house-2011/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 10 Nov 2011 18:15:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?p=796</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Photos from Technologies Extreme Haunted House 2011 by <a href="http://www.facebook.com/bigpunn316">Jose Vega</a> © Big Punn Photos
Pyromancy Performances: October 22,23,30 and 31st 2011

[gallery id="740"]

Terror Technologies Extreme Haunted House 2011 in Buffalo NY
* 11 days and 45 hours of operation raised $1,060.00 for Make-A-Wish,
* 1,914 pounds for the <a href="http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=159782377435662">FEED THE CITY - a Benefit Concert for Food Bank of WNY</a>!
* Drew enough blood for Upstate NY Transplant Services
* <a href="http://www.facebook.com/unyts">UNYTS - Donate Life</a> to save 18 lives in Western New York and several hefty bags filled with winter hats / gloves / scarfs for<a href="http://www.facebook.com/heartsforthehomeless1990"> Hearts for the Homeless of WNY Inc.</a> ®. 
* Food drive total for Operation One Ton Food Challenge has raised a whopping 3,672 pounds of food, just 328 pounds short of Two tons. * Attendance was 4,121 for 2011. Not bad for Home Haunters!
- <a href="http://terrortechnologies.rochesterbusinesstech.com/">Terror Technologies</a>
- <a href="http://www.facebook.com/terrortech">Terror Technologies Facebook</a>



]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Weekly SpinJam and Skill Share at ALT Theatre</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2012/03/weekly-spinjam-and-skill-share-at-alt-theatre/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 10 Mar 2012 05:50:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.pyromancy.org/?p=911</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pyromancy will be having an indoor Spin Jam on a weekly basis at ALT Theatre every Monday from 7pm-10pm. This event is for anyone interested in hoop, staff, poi, fans, dart, juggling and other props. There will have some extra hoops available to use. This will be a skill share, so if there is anything you would like to learn, please ask! Come learn new skills and practice with us in this theatre with full dance studio mirrors!

<strong>- To receive regular updates on this event ( and other similar ones ) please join the <a href="http://www.facebook.com/#!/groups/297816110269993/">Buffalo Spin Jams Facebook group.</a></strong>

A $5 fee per person is payable directly to the theatre and is required to pay for heat/lighting/space rental. Buzz the doorbell to get let in an follow the signs to ALT Theatre - Its on the third floor. The address is 255 Great Arrow Ave (3rd floor), Buffalo, NY ( <a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?q=255+Great+Arrow+Ave+(3rd+floor),+Buffalo,+NY&amp;hl=en&amp;sll=37.0625,-95.677068&amp;sspn=51.310143,96.152344&amp;hnear=255+Great+Arrow+Ave,+Buffalo,+New+York+14207&amp;t=m&amp;z=16">google map</a> ) See you then!
<p style="text-align: center;">Here is a quick video from 2-27-12 when we turned the lights off for the second half and played with LED toys:</p>
<p style="text-align: center;">

[iframe src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/FQYxh1ZrJyk" width="560" height="315"]
</p>
<p style="text-align: center;"></p>
<p style="text-align: center;">And detailed map/instructions for how to get in the theatre
<a href="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/guide-to-get-to-the-alt.png"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-912 aligncenter" title="guide-to-get-to-the-alt" src="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/guide-to-get-to-the-alt-300x200.png" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Buffalo River Fest: Not to be missed!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/2012/06/buffalo-river-fest-not-to-be-missed/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 14 Jun 2012 14:40:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.pyromancy.org/?p=1085</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pyromancy will be performing at Buffalo Riverfest at 249 Ohio Street, Buffalo, NY ( <a href="https://maps.google.com/maps?q=249+Ohio+Street,+Buffalo,+NY&amp;hl=en&amp;sll=37.0625,-95.677068&amp;sspn=30.544155,51.416016&amp;hnear=249+Ohio+St,+Buffalo,+New+York+14203&amp;t=m&amp;z=16">map</a> ) June 16th 2012 after 7:00 pm ( around sundown )
<br/><em><strong><a href="http://www.buffalorising.com/2012/06/buffalo-river-fest-not-to-be-missed.html">Excerpt from Buffalo Rising</a>...</strong>
</em>
 <a style="float: right; margin: 20px;"  href="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/Pyromancy-River-Buffalo-NY-thumb-375xauto-30702.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-1087" title="Pyromancy-River-Buffalo-NY-thumb-375xauto-30702" src="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/Pyromancy-River-Buffalo-NY-thumb-375xauto-30702-300x224.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="224" /></a>
While the Allentown Art Festival is currently in full swing, the folks down in the old First Ward are preparing for next weekend's mighty river festival appropriately called Buffalo River Fest. I've attended this festival for years now, and can honestly say that there is nothing else like it around. While the Riverfest Regatta is a big draw for both contestants and onlookers alike, there are so many other fun-filled events and activities taking place throughout the course of the weekend.

The Valley Community Center does a spectacular job each year... and while the past eleven years have been action packed with tons of family fun, this year is looking like it will be the best yet. Why? Because Riverfest is, for the second season, showing off its new home at Buffalo River Fest Park located at 249 Ohio Street, Buffalo, NY, near Michigan Avenue. New to this year's festival will be Buffalo Scholastic Rowing Club Races (see latest news of the boathouse to be built). Now that the festival is located so close to the rowing club, it's a natural fit for coinciding races... hopefully we'll see the numbers of rowers and spectators grow each and every year. Also, don't pass up the chance to take a ride on Buffalo's historic EM Cotter Fireboat -the oldest operating fireboat in the world!

If you're tired of going to the same festivals year after year, you need to expand your horizons and get down to the Buffalo River next weekend. The festival is situated directly in-between the Inner and Outer Harbors, which means that you can spend more time exploring new waterfront parks, restaurants, bike trails, boardwalks... you can even check out the massive grain silos, Mutual Riverfront Park, The Swannie House, McCarthy's Irish Pub... there's so much to see and do that one weekend is just not enough!

Here are all of the details!!!

The Valley Community Association's 12th Annual "Buffalo River Fest" is scheduled for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, June 15th - 17th, 2012. The event will be held from 6pm to Midnight on Friday, from 11am to Midnight on Saturday, and Noon to 6pm on Sunday at Buffalo River Fest Park.

<em><strong><a href="http://www.buffalorising.com/2012/06/buffalo-river-fest-not-to-be-missed.html">Read more at Buffalo Rising</a> including a breakdown of the different activities that will be taking place!</strong></em>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Photos from Sirius Rising by <a href="http://miaphoto.net/">Mia Photography </a>. Gillian and Potter presented workshops on fire safety, hoop, rope dart, staff and performed at the saturday night bonfires! Mandy Moore also pictured with her fire snakes.
